Sam wrote:

> We just updated to the most recent version of Heritrix from CVS on our
> project, and we were confused to find that our list of seed URIs now
> seems to be interpreted as a list of files from which to get seeds.
>
> The description for seeds (on new.jsp) still says:
> "Fill in seed URIs below, one per line. Comment lines begin with '#'."
>
> When I view the settings after setting some seeds, however, it says,
> "Seed list too large to edit" under seeds, with the words "seed list"
> linking to what I put in the seeds box.  This happens even if we only
> list one seed.  What is going on?

May I have your seed list to try on this end (You can send via private 
mail: stack at archive dot org).

>
> ---
>
> Also, we're trying to retrieve files from a secure server (using the
> Rfc2617 credentials).  When the credentials are wrong, we get a 401
> error as expected.  However, when the credentials are correct, it
> hangs while trying to retrieve robots.txt (which is not on the
> server).  On a non-secure server, things worked fine (it would get a
> 404 error while trying to retrieve robots.txt, then move on to
> retrieving the desired files).
>
What JVM/platform are you on?  Is all of the site protected with 
RFC2617?  If not, can you crawl the unprotected areas?

The exception below is interesting.  We've not seen it before.  We 
insert our own streams under httpclient and indeed they do not support 
mark/reset.  Its not been a problem up to this.  Perhaps this needs to 
change.

Thanks,
St.Ack

> Here's the stack trace:
